file_content.text: What's our status, Master Satele?
We've arrived at New Uphrades, Master Satele. What's the colony's status?
Siege conditions, I'm afraid. Darth Legius's flagship, the Vindicator, dropped out of hyperspace moments before you arrived. I'm still en route with the fleet.
The colony has mobilized its defenses, but the Vindicator's shields are operating at two-hundred-percent. He'll reach the colony long before they fail.
We don't know Legius's intentions. But the fact that he hasn't changed course, despite taking damage... I fear Sergeant Rusk may be correct.
You assume he intends to stop in orbit.
You're saying Legius is going to ram his ship into the colony?
He's planning to crash?
Losing Project Sever was supposed to be the end for Legius. Has the Empire sanctioned this attack?
What about the Dark Council?
Legius fights alone, but if he succeeds, the Empire wins a major victory. They wouldn't dream of interrupting him now.
Crashing his ship means everyone on board dies. Even Legius isn't that crazy.
This is all a big bluff.
Legius is a man of extremes. We cannot underestimate him now.
This has trap written all over it. Legius has already fooled us twice--are we really going for a third?
If we are to stop him, we must know his plans--even if it means setting them in motion.
Fighters from New Uphrades have weakened the shields around the Vindicator's docking bay. You can land inside and infiltrate the ship from there.
I won't make it with the fleet in time. Whatever Legius has planned, you must stop him alone.
Legius will target the innocent first. The colony should begin evacuating.
Warn New Uphrades.
Communications are still open. We'll make sure the Protectors are advising.
Say I'm killed, or Legius locks me in a force field. What happens then?
Not much of a plan.
You may well be the most powerful Jedi in the Order. If you cannot save New Uphrades, no one can.
Whatever happens on that ship, I can promise you Darth Legius won't survive.
Legius is going down.
Remember your teachings. He is desperate, and we can still offer him a way out.
We'll continue monitoring the situation, and alert you when we arrive. May the Force be with us all.
Before we depart, master--a message was left for you. I believe it's from the Protectors.
You might not have time to hear this--I barely found time to record it. Here goes anyway.
You and I have unfinished business. I already lost one person I cared about in this--I can't lose another.
I'm not saying you can't beat Legius, because I know you can. Just... please, be careful. Love, Audra.
Victorious. Darth Legius is dead, the Vindicator is destroyed, and New Uphrades is safe. The fleet is already returning to the front lines.
Jedi + T7 + crew = Republic heroes again!
A Harrower-class dreadnought like the Vindicator would have produced several tonnes of debris. Were there any casualties in the colony?
Some serious damage, but no deaths so far. We're evacuating those areas and treating the injured now.
Legius sacrificed everything to destroy New Uphrades, but you still managed to defeat him. The Force was with you today, Hero of Tython.
If Legius had succeeded, every civilian we've saved since Talravin would have been lost.
Failure wasn't an option.
Makes you wonder if we really should have put 'em in one place.
My mission was to bring Legius to justice. Now that he's dead, what are my instructions?
What happens now?
Maybe they'll start calling me the Hero of New Uphrades. I've certainly earned it.
Time for another medal.
I'll leave that decision to someone who values such things.
I've informed Supreme Chancellor Saresh of your victory. She requests that we meet her in person, aboard the Resolute. We'll speak more there.
You know what the Jedi say about relationships? How they're dangerous and a path to the dark side and all that?
I'm starting to think that's true. I've been having all these violent urges lately... usually whenever I see you, or Doctor Kantos.
And when I see you together? I mean, wow... kind of makes me want to hit you upside the head, you know?
It's harmless flirtation, that's all. You're the one I really care about.
She's nothing to me.
Pretty easy to call it harmless when you aren't the one being harmed.
We just stopped a Sith Lord and saved a colony from destruction. Can we enjoy that for a second first?
Do we have to fight now?
The rule is against attachment, not relationships. I'm trying to protect myself, and you.
This is the Jedi way.
And how's that working out for you, master?
You promised it would be me and only me, forever. Just because it's a secret doesn't mean you can ignore that.
You're an amazing woman, Kira. No one else even comes close.
It's always been you.
Better. You still owe me though.
We can start with a foot rub. Maybe watch some HoloNet feeds. You like romance vids, right?
Audra and I have a connection. I can't ignore that, even if it means losing you.
Sorry, I choose her.
Good, because you just did.
I'm just following our teachings. If you had other relationships, I wouldn't mind.
We can both explore options.
For the Jedi who killed the Emperor, you are really stupid.
Well, here we are. Another crazy Sith down, about a million or so to go.
Kinda hard to feed good about this one. Legius wanted to die. Died thinking he won, even.
Still don't know how he did it. Giving the order, knowing it's a one-way trip... can you imagine?
I could never throw my life away--not for a cause like that.
It's unimaginable.
Legius was trying to do what he thought was best for the Empire.
He had good intentions.
Missed that target by a few kilometers, didn't he?
Legius was crazy. Let's leave it at that.
Why bother thinking about it?
I'm just talking. Not like I want to go crash Kaas City or anything.
Not a big fan of dying, personally. Not for the Republic, not for the Jedi, not even for a herd of baby taun-tauns.
For someone I loved, though... that might be worth it. Especially if I could haunt him afterwards.
Good luck with that plan. I'd die before I let anything happen to you.
I feel the same way.
And I had all these ghostly future predictions too. Ah, well.
I'm flattered, but if it's all the same to you, I'd rather we both lived.
No dying, please.
Oh yeah, me too. Wasn't that obvious?
Dying for me wouldn't accomplish anything. No one is worth that kind of sacrifice.
You're being foolish.
What a romantic! Watch out, ladies, I think I might swoon.
Come on, tough guy. It's been a long day, and I think you've earned a backrub or two.
So, you and Doctor Kantos. Seems to be going well. Almost as well as it went in my head.
If you're doing this for my benefit, don't. I've got a good imagination. Out here, I'd rather it was just you and me.
If I'd known how much you cared, I might not have pursued her.
I'm glad to hear that.
We got married, remember? The droid, the ceremony, the honeymoon? Not sure why you'd need a reminder.
I barely escaped that dreadnought alive. Is this really the best time to be picking a fight?
Not now, Doc....
What can I say? I like to move fast.
If you actually think our relationship was for your benefit, you're even sleazier than I thought.
You're a pig!
Call me what you like, gorgeous, but I'm not the one stringing two people along at once.
Tell you what: I figure I had this coming. Not for anything I did to you, but maybe a few things I've done over the years.
So I'm giving you a free pass. One time only, good for a clean slate and a fresh start. Forget her. What do you say?
I never meant to hurt you. I promise no one will come between us again.
I accept, and I'm sorry.
I'm gonna hold you to that.
All right, enough talk. Let's go make up the right way, huh?
Audra and I could become something special. I owe it to us both to find out.
Audra means more to me.
Well, make sure she treats you right. I would have.
You know what you can do with your free pass, Doc?
Not in a million years.
Yeah, I got it. Don't need the Force to see that one.
As your doctor, I feel I should advise you: all this fighting? Kinda hazardous to your health.
Not that I don't enjoy checking you for injuries--just don't like finding them. You've had enough lately to make it a hobby.
Might be time to start thinking retirement. I could open up a practice, you could be my nurse....
I could never leave the Order, Doc. Not as long as there are men like Legius around.
The Republic needs me.
So I'm gonna be dodging blaster fire 'til I'm old and grey, huh?
We'd never get anything done that way. All the patients would die in the waiting room.
Sounds too tempting.
Don't you worry, darlin'. Ol' Doc knows how to multi-task.
No applause, no medals, no free drinks? I'd give it about a week.
You'd get bored.
You know me too well. Pretty sure I could still get free drinks, though.
Eh, being a hero's not so bad either. Saving lives, protecting Protectors, taking down the craziest Sith to ever leave Korriban....
After all that, I think you've earned a victory party. We could make an evening out of it. A morning, too.
I can't think of a better way to celebrate.
Sounds good.
I can. But we'll start small.
We could go to Nar Shaddaa, get a hotel, spend some time in the casinos....
Why stop there?
You're reading my mind again, aren't you? I love it when you do that.
We have a meeting with the Supreme Chancellor. I wouldn't want to keep her waiting.
Maybe later.
Suit yourself. I'll be in my bunk if you change your mind.
What does he think will happen when hits orbit? They'll just turn off their guns and surrender?
I'm so pleased you're joining the Protectors, master. I estimate your life expectancy will rise by three-point-seven years as a result!
Now we all report to Doctor Kantos. Thanks for that.
Doctor Kantos has granted us access to Protector resources, and we are registered with emergency services. But our squad operates on its own.
Protectors = save lives // Jedi + T7 = save lives // Jedi + T7 = chose correctly!
Gotta say, I'm a little surprised. I thought every Jedi wanted to be Battlemaster. That, or be Master Satele.
A Jedi's first duty is to protect the innocent. If I can do that without fighting, I will.
I prefer peace.
I could recommend you for Battlemaster instead. You're as accomplished as I am.
Go ahead--take the job.
No second place finish for me, thanks. I'll defeat another Emperor and earn it myself some day.
After you've defeated the Emperor, even Battlemaster sounds a little boring.
I'm no ordinary Jedi.
Wow, your head really has swelled. I thought it was just the light.
Well, obnoxious CO or not, this gig is right up my alley. Cute kids, grateful familes, lots of beautiful, desperate women.
I am wondering about our resident Sith Lord, though. The Wrath probably didn't do much rescuing.
Battlemaster on deck!
Guess I better start bowing when I see you. Maybe I was supposed to be doing that all along.
Battlemaster = great responsibility // T7 = proud of Jedi!
Ugh, responsibility. Like you needed more of that.
You given any thought to how the rest of us fit in with you training Padawans and charging into battle?
I couldn't have come this far without my crew. Whatever comes next, I want you all at my side.
Your help is always welcome.
I don't think I'll be spending a lot of time on Tython--not until the war is over. We're needed out here.
I suspect we'll be... active.
Not so comforting.
But not surprising.
Don't expect me to retire to Tython just yet. My becoming Battlemaster won't keep us from the front.
It's just one more task.
What about Scourge? Disappointed they passed you up for the battling job?
My opinion is irrelevant. I knew the Jedi would choose this path.
How? Because you're such good pals?
Three hundred years ago, I had a vision of the Jedi who would defeat the Emperor. Did you think it would be my only one?
You have a connection to the Force I've never matched.
I admit, I'm impressed.
In this regard alone, perhaps.
What did you see?
So you knew I would join the Protectors. Was there anything more?
So you knew I would become Battlemaster. Was there anything more?
I can think of a few times having a Sith who sees the future might have been handy.
Now you tell me.
I saw nothing of Legius, or his plans. My vision was of your destiny alone.
You will find peace with the Protectors. Clearing rubble, healing the sick, defending your allies when necessary.
Your actions will bring hope to Republic forces, but war will find you once again. When that time comes, how will the Jedi Protector respond?
As Battlemaster, you will lead the Republic to many victories. The Jedi will grow strong. You will grow stronger.
But the Empire will rebound. When that time comes, how will the Jedi Battlemaster respond?
Vengeance is a battle we can't win. The enemy will always find a way to hurt us--hurting them back won't help.
We act with mercy.
Protecting innocent lives must come first. That's what sets us apart from the Empire, and makes all the fighting worth it.
Men like Legius will come and go. But as long as the Republic stays true to itself, we will never be defeated.
You saw me defeat the Emperor, but you didn't know how. You've seen where my path leads, but you don't know its course.
Let's find out, in the future.
I don't know the enemy's plans. I can't promise kindness or cruelty any more than I can promise victory or defeat.
All we can do is fight for the Republic's survival and seek the end of this war--and hope we live to see both.
Someday, when the Sith are extinct and the Empire destroyed, the galaxy will know peace. Until then, we're at war.
We act with force.
If we want to win, we can't hold anything back. We've seen the fanaticism of the enemy--the extremes the Sith will embrace.
Next time, we won't wait for them to attack us. The Republic will make the next strike--and it'll be one to remember.
Tefani and I have been summoned too. Hopefully we'll get a moment alone afterwards.
Safe journey--I'm so glad you're all right.
If we're not too busy shining medals.
Yeah. Got a few things I'd like to say to you myself.
If he hopes to destroy it, I see no alternative. I truly hope he'll prove me wrong.
Better now than in front of the Supreme Chancellor, don't you think?
